entries.title: Who is having their best-ever season? Garth's Team of the Week
entries.description: Who is a handful for defenders? Who has enormous mental strength? It's Garth Crooks' Team of the Week.

entries.title: Ros Atkins on… Funding and the NHS crisis
entries.description: Ros Atkins looks at the issue of how the NHS has been funded.

entries.title: William and Harry, a life in the spotlight
entries.description: From birth, the royal brother's lives have been closely watched from around the world.

entries.title: Chelsea 0-1 Manchester City: 18-year-old Rico Lewis was 'extraordinary' says Pep Guardiola
entries.description: Manchester City boss Pep Guardiola says 18-year-old Rico Lewis had an "extraordinary" impact after coming on as a half-time substitute and helping his side to victory over Chelsea.

entries.title: 'Footballers are not robots' - Ten Hag on Sancho
entries.description: Manchester United manager Erik ten Hag says he will be patient reintroducing Jadon Sancho to his team as "footballers are not robots".

entries.title: Sierra Madre: The deadly battle to save a rainforest in the Philippines
entries.description: Around 90% of the Sierra Madre, which protects the Philippines from the worst of climate change, is gone.

entries.title: Chelsea 0-1 Manchester City: Riyad Mahrez goal moves champions within five points of Arsenal
entries.description: Champions Manchester City move to within five points of Arsenal at the top of the Premier League with a win at Chelsea.

entries.title: Lazio racism: Fans' chants mean part of stadium to be closed
entries.description: Lazio are ordered to close part of their stadium for their next match after racist abuse was directed at two Leece players.

entries.title: Harry makes series of sensational claims in new memoir
entries.description: Harry claims William physically attacked him, and says he urged his father not to marry Camilla.

entries.title: El Chapo's son, Ovidio Guzmán-López, reportedly arrested amid violence in Sinaloa
entries.description: Ovidio Guzmán-López is thought to be a high-ranking member of Mexico's Sinaloa drug cartel.

entries.title: Row between head coach Gregg Berhalter and Reyna family 'a sad and pathetic day for US soccer'
entries.description: The "soap opera" involving US head coach Gregg Berhalter and the Reyna family is "a pathetic day for US soccer," says ex-international Heather O'Reilly.

entries.title: CES 2023: Sony unveils controller for disabled gamers
entries.description: The Project Leonardo controller is announced five years after Microsoft released its accessible gamepad.

entries.title: Carole Packman murder: Russell Causley to be released from prison
entries.description: Russell Causley murdered his wife Carole Packman in 1985 but has never revealed where her body is.

entries.title: Ukraine war: Putin orders 36-hour ceasefire over Orthodox Christmas
entries.description: Putin asks Kyiv to reciprocate with its own ceasefire order - but Ukraine rejects the request.

entries.title: Damar Hamlin's condition has improved after cardiac arrest, his team says
entries.description: Buffalo Bills player is "neurologically intact" after collapsing on the pitch due to a cardiac arrest.

entries.title: Andretti Global combines with General Motors to enter F1
entries.description: The American Andretti Global team join forces with US car giant General Motors with the intention of entering Formula 1.

entries.title: Strike rules: What are they and who is allowed to strike?
entries.description: What are the rules on striking and do you have to be a trade union member to take part?

entries.title: Who is striking? How Friday 6 January's walkouts will affect you
entries.description: What you need to know about the rail strike and other industrial action, by the BBC's Zoe Conway.

entries.title: Frank Lampard: Everton boss says he is 'not seeking reassurances' over his job
entries.description: Everton boss Frank Lampard says he is not "hunting around for any reassurances" with his side in 18th place in the Premier League table.

entries.title: Dudley nursery death of boy aged one 'suspicious'
entries.description: Six women suspected of manslaughter offences are arrested following his death last month.

entries.title: England midfielder Nobbs joins Villa from Arsenal
entries.description: England midfielder Jordan Nobbs signs an 18-month deal with the option to extend for Women's Super League club Aston Villa.

entries.title: Enzo Fernandez: Benfica boss criticises Chelsea pursuit of Argentina midfielder
entries.description: Benfica manager Roger Schmidt criticises Chelsea in their pursuit of Argentina midfielder Enzo Fernandez.

entries.title: Barber shop owner jailed for using Covid grants to fund terrorists
entries.description: Tarek Namouz sent money he received from a London council to help organise attacks in Syria.

entries.title: Benoit Badiashile: Chelsea sign defender on long-term deal
entries.description: Chelsea have signed defender Benoit Badiashile from Monaco on a seven-and-a-half-year deal.

entries.title: Prince Harry: One unanswered claim at the heart of his story
entries.description: The duke says the people he was told to rely on to defend him were feeding the media negative stories.

entries.title: Luton Hoo hope to bring Ryder Cup to England by 2035
entries.description: The hotel's owners, Arora Group, say hosting the international tournament is "a very real ambition".

entries.title: Pub shooting victim had bright future, says coroner
entries.description: Elle Edwards, who was shot on Christmas Eve in Wallasey, was a "beautiful young woman", a coroner says.

entries.title: Evacuations ordered in California as massive storm slams into coast
entries.description: The storm is expected to bring deadly flooding, landsides, and power outages affecting millions.

entries.title: Keir Starmer embraces Brexit slogan with 'take back control' pledge
entries.description: The Labour leader promises to transfer powers from Westminster and turn the slogan into a "solution".

entries.title: Keir Starmer: Labour would repeal new law restricting strikes
entries.description: Reports suggest ministers want minimum service levels in the NHS and on the railways during strikes.

entries.title: Harry will not say if he will attend coronation
entries.description: The Duke of Sussex says the “ball is in their court” in this family dispute, in an ITV trailer.

entries.title: Channel 4: Culture Secretary Michelle Donelan confirms U-turn on privatisation
entries.description: The government says it will not go ahead with a controversial plan to sell the broadcaster.

entries.title: Pope and 50,000 mourners say farewell to Benedict
entries.description: Former Pope Benedict's funeral takes place at the Vatican, as Francis celebrates Mass with pilgrims.

entries.title: Australia helicopter crash: Couple were on post-Covid visit, family say
entries.description: Ron and Diane Hughes were visiting relatives "after being separated by Covid", their family say.

entries.title: Iron Maiden release limited edition postal stamps with Royal Mail
entries.description: English heavy metal band Iron Maiden have been honoured with a set of twelve commemorative stamps.

entries.title: Green farming schemes to be paid more taxpayers' money
entries.description: The amount of money paid to farmers in England for environmental work will rise, the government says.

entries.title: ASB Classic: Emma Raducanu retires in tears with ankle injury 11 days before Australian Open
entries.description: Emma Raducanu retires from her match against Viktoria Kuzmova with an ankle injury, just 11 days before the start of the Australian Open.

entries.title: China Covid: Celebrity deaths spark fears over death toll
entries.description: News of public figures' deaths has sparked speculation about greater losses than officials have reported.

entries.title: Prince Harry: The door's always open, the ball is in their court
entries.description: In a trailer for a new ITV interview, the prince is also asked if he will attend his father's coronation.

entries.title: Utah shooting: Eight family members found shot dead in home
entries.description: Police were conducting a welfare check when they found the bodies.

entries.title: UK weather: 2022 was warmest year ever, Met Office confirms
entries.description: The average annual temperature last year was more than 10C for the first time, the Met Office says.

entries.title: Belinda Clark: Australia legend becomes first female cricketer to have statue
entries.description: Former Australia captain Belinda Clark becomes the first female cricketer to have a statue cast of her, with a bronze sculpture unveiled at the Sydney Cricket Ground.

entries.title: Australia v South Africa: Usman Khawaja on verge of maiden double century as Australia dominate
entries.description: Usman Khawaja is on the verge of completing a maiden Test double century as Australia continue to dominate South Africa.

entries.title: NBA: Golden State Warriors lose to Detroit Pistons after late three-pointer
entries.description: A Saddiq Bey three-pointer seals a breathtaking 122-119 victory for the Detroit Pistons at the Golden State Warriors.

entries.title: Next warns of 8% price rise for spring and summer
entries.description: The High Street retailer expects price increases to continue into the second half of 2023.

entries.title: Brit shot in Jamaica contract killing, police say
entries.description: Sean Patterson from London was shot and killed by a pool at a guest house in Jamaica.

entries.title: FA Cup third round: Watch five live games on BBC including Sheffield Wednesday-Newcastle & Man City-Chelsea
entries.description: The FA Cup third round sees Premier League and Championship teams enter and you can follow all the action this weekend on the BBC.

entries.title: Prince Harry accuses Prince William of physical attack in book - report
entries.description: In his book Spare, the Duke of Sussex claims his brother pushed him to the floor, the Guardian says.

entries.title: Man solves 20,000-year Ice Age drawings mystery
entries.description: Furniture conservator Ben Bacon spent hours of his own time decoding markings on cave paintings.

entries.title: Australia helicopter crash footage 'shows warning'
entries.description: A survivor of a deadly helicopter collision in Australia is seen apparently trying to warn a pilot.

entries.title: Pope Benedict XVI: Around 200,000 attend lying in state
entries.description: His funeral is to take place in front of St Peter's Basilica at the Vatican on Thursday.

entries.title: How the US Speaker stalemate could finally end
entries.description: The US House of Representatives will return on Thursday after six failed votes. What needs to change?

entries.title: The Papers: 'PM's five pledges' and '£122m PPE unsafe for NHS'
entries.description: Thursday's front pages report on five key pledges laid out by Rishi Sunak to restore the UK economy.

entries.title: The Somali gold rush endangering frankincense and myrrh
entries.description: Miners in Somaliland are uprooting centuries-old trees used since antiquity to make perfume.

entries.title: All The Beauty and the Bloodshed film explores Sackler scandal
entries.description: A documentary about the Nan Goldin-led protests against the Sackler family aims for more award glory.

entries.title: UK new car sales hit 30 year low but electric vehicle demand soars
entries.description: A chip shortage contributed to the drop in car registrations in 2022 - but electric cars boost market share.

entries.title: David Gold: West Ham joint-chairman was 'desperate' for club to do well, says David Moyes
entries.description: West Ham manager David Moyes describes David Gold as "a good man and a sensible man" who was supportive and keen to see the club do well.

entries.title: Girl group Flo win the BBC Sound Of 2023
entries.description: The London trio, whose throwback R&B sound is compared to Destiny's Child, are tipped for the top.

entries.title: Match of the Day analysis: How 'fantastic' Bryan Gil gave Spurs much-needed creativity
entries.description: Match of the Day pundit Ian Wright explains how a "fantastic" performance from 21-year-old Spanish winger Bryan Gil gave Tottenham the creativity they needed to beat Crystal Palace.

entries.title: Strikes may be stepped up, train drivers' union warns
entries.description: Train drivers union Aslef’s leader says action may escalate, and members are in it for the long haul.
